creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: large reproduction of black and white image of Native Americans dancing, wearing feathered headdresses, beadwork garments and leggings and knee bands with bells; white text in sky:  "Protect us by Thy might"; white text at bottom of image:  "INDIAN WAR DANCE A 381 (circled) / RISE PHOTO RAPID CITY S.D."; quillwork American flag affixed at bottom center of photo above caption; text written in black ink in cursive in bottom margin: "Native American send proportionally more of their people off to war more than any other group in America."
title: Dear America: Protect Us By Thy Might
